chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt E Brewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

in Wisconsin State Prison System consecutive.
Consecutive to: any other sentence previously imposed

superMiscConds.notes: The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 40% of the Defendant's income.
Shall submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and any other assessment recommended and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

supervisions.notes: shall be installed on any motor vehicle owned and/or operated by defendant.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
10:33 AM Defendant Kurt E Brewer in court.  Attorney Alyssa F. George-Stifler in court for Kurt E Brewer.  Attorney Jin Ho D. Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews agreement with Defendant. Court reviews charges and possible penalties with Defendant. Court reviews PQWOR with Defendant. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to Count 1:OWI (5th), Count 2: Oper. while Revoked is DISMISSED AND READ IN. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant GUILTY. Parties stipulate to a BAC of .229. Attorney Pack reviews Defendant's criminal history, current charges and recommendation. Attorney George-Stifler makes statement and sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes statement to the Court. Court sentences Defendant to:

Count 1: OWI (5th)
   18 months initial confinement
   36 months ES
     -Absolute Sobriety
     -Assessment and Follow through with Recommendations
     -NO  Bars, Taverns, Beer Tents, Liquor Stores or other business whose primary business is sale of alcohol
   FINE: $600 + Costs
   DNA Sample & Surcharge
   36 months DL Revocation
   36 months IID
   $26 Blood Draw Fee to BD Hospital
   NO VOTING
   NO FIREARMS

*Sentence is CONSECUTIVE
*Eligible for Programming
*3 Days sentence Credit-Upon Verification
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on July 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

8:24 AM Defendant Kurt E Brewer in court.  Attorney Jin Pack in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alyssa F. George in court for Kurt E Brewer. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

01:11 PM Defendant Kurt E Brewer in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kurt E Brewer appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 Cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
